p:
Human parechovirus type 3 was the most common type of parechovirus identified from cases during the 2017/18 epidemic in south eastern Australia. Viruses belonging to the Australian recombinant HPeV3 lineage were identified in all but two of the HPeV3 cases sampled, making the 2017/18 epidemic the third consecutive Australian epidemic
20 where this lineage was the predominant virus sequenced from young infants with severe clinical disease.
